name: Moroccan Vegetable Tagine
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot or tagine. 2. Add chopped onions and garlic, sauté until softened. 3. Stir in spices (cumin, coriander, turmeric, ginger, cinnamon) and cook for 1 minute. 4. Add chopped vegetables (carrots, zucchini, bell peppers, potatoes) and chickpeas. 5. Pour in vegetable broth and diced tomatoes. 6. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 30-40 minutes, or until vegetables are tender. 7. Stir in chopped cilantro and lemon juice before serving. Serve with couscous or quinoa.

name: Indian Vegetable Curry
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a pot. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds, let them splutter. 2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. 4. Add chopped vegetables (potatoes, cauliflower, peas, carrots) and curry powder. 5. Stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes. 6. Add diced tomatoes and vegetable broth. 7. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender. 8. Stir in coconut milk and cilantro before serving. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Israeli Salad with Tahini
instructions: 1. Finely chop cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onion. 2. Combine chopped vegetables in a bowl. 3. Add fresh parsley and mint, chopped. 4. Dress with lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. 5. Drizzle generously with tahini sauce before serving.

name: Miso Soup with Tofu and Seaweed
instructions: 1. Bring dashi or vegetable broth to a simmer in a pot. 2. Reduce heat to low, and whisk in miso paste until dissolved. Do not boil after adding miso. 3. Add cubed tofu, dried seaweed (wakame or nori), and sliced green onions. 4. Simmer gently for 5-7 minutes to heat through and soften seaweed. Serve hot.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions: 1. Cook quinoa according to package directions. Let cool. 2. Chop cucumbers, bell peppers, red onion, and Kalamata olives. 3. Combine cooked quinoa with chopped vegetables, crumbled feta cheese (optional - omit for strict pareve), and sun-dried tomatoes. 4. Dress with olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Toss gently. 5. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

5006.original_quantity: 50g sun-dried tomatoes, oil-packed, drained and chopped

name: Black Bean Soup
instructions: 1. Soak dried black beans overnight (if using dried). If using canned, drain and rinse. 2. Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery, sauté until softened. 3. Add minced garlic, cumin, and chili powder, cook for 1 minute. 4. Add black beans, vegetable broth, and bay leaf. 5. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 1-1.5 hours (if using dried beans) or 20-25 minutes (if using canned), or until beans are tender. 6. Remove bay leaf. Use an immersion blender to partially blend the soup for a creamy texture (optional). 7. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with cilantro or a dollop of pareve sour cream (optional).

6001.original_quantity: 250g dried black beans OR 2 cans (400g each) black beans

6012.original_quantity: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

name: Minestrone Soup
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery, sauté until softened. 2. Add minced garlic and dried oregano, cook for 1 minute. 3. Add diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, cannellini beans (drained and rinsed), and ditalini pasta. 4. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until pasta is cooked and vegetables are tender. 5. Stir in chopped spinach or kale during the last few minutes of cooking. 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil (optional).

7009.original_quantity: 400g can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed

7013.original_quantity: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

name: Ratatouille
instructions: 1. Slice eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers into rounds. Chop onions and tomatoes. Mince garlic. 2. Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven. Add onions and garlic, sauté until softened. 3. Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell peppers in layers. 4. Top with chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, herbs (thyme, basil, oregano), salt, and pepper. 5. Cover and bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 1-1.5 hours, or until vegetables are tender. 6. Uncover for the last 20 minutes of baking for some browning. Serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with fresh basil (optional).

name: Vegetarian Paella
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a paella pan or large skillet. Add chopped onions and bell peppers, sauté until softened. 2. Add minced garlic and paprika, cook for 1 minute. 3. Stir in paella rice (Bomba or Arborio) and cook for 1 minute more. 4. Add vegetable broth, saffron threads (if using), peas, artichoke hearts, and olives. 5. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed. Do not stir during cooking. 6. Let rest, covered, for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with lemon wedges and fresh parsley.

9010.original_quantity: 200g artichoke hearts, canned or frozen, quartered

9012.original_quantity: 1 lemon, cut into wedges, for serving

9013.original_quantity: 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish

name: Lentil Soup
instructions: 1. Rinse lentils. Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery, sauté until softened. 2. Add minced garlic and cumin, cook for 1 minute. 3. Add lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, and bay leaf. 4. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils are tender. 5. Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of olive oil or lemon juice (optional).

10012.original_quantity: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

10013.original_quantity: 1 tbsp olive oil or lemon juice, for garnish (optional)

name: Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Chop vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers). 2. Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, pepper, and dried herbs (rosemary or thyme). Spread on a baking sheet. 3. Place salmon fillets on the same baking sheet alongside vegetables. 4. Drizzle salmon with olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 5. Roast for 15-20 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

11004.original_quantity: 2 bell peppers (any color), cut into strips

name: Baked Cod with Lemon and Herbs
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Place cod fillets in a baking dish. 2. Drizzle cod with olive oil and lemon juice. 3. Sprinkle with minced garlic, chopped parsley, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. 4. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cod is cooked through and flakes easily. Garnish with lemon wedges before serving.

12009.original_quantity: 1 lemon, cut into wedges, for serving

name: Pareve Tuna Salad
instructions: 1. Drain tuna well. In a bowl, combine tuna with mayonnaise (pareve), finely chopped celery, finely chopped red onion, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 2. Mix well. Serve on lettuce leaves, in sandwiches, or with crackers.

13001.original_quantity: 2 cans (150g each) tuna in water, drained

name: Classic Chicken Soup (Kosher Style)
instructions: 1. Place chicken pieces in a large pot. Cover with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, skimming off any foam. 2. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery. 3. Add salt, pepper, and dill (optional). 4. Simmer for 1.5-2 hours, or until chicken is very tender and vegetables are cooked. 5. Remove chicken and shred meat (optional, can serve as is). Return shredded chicken to the soup. Adjust seasoning if needed. Serve hot with matzah balls or noodles (optional, cooked separately).

14001.original_quantity: 1 whole chicken or 8-10 chicken pieces (legs, thighs, wings)

14006.original_quantity: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

name: Roast Chicken with Potatoes
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut potatoes into chunks. Chop onions and garlic. 2. Toss potatoes and onions with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika. Spread in a roasting pan. 3. Place chicken on top of potatoes. Rub chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. 4. Roast for 1-1.25 hours, or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender. Baste chicken with pan juices a few times during roasting. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Brisket with Root Vegetables
instructions: 1. Season brisket generously with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat. Sear brisket on all sides until browned. Remove brisket from pot. 2. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery to the pot, sauté until softened. Add minced garlic and tomato paste, cook for 1 minute. 3. Return brisket to the pot. Add beef broth, bay leaf, and thyme sprigs. 4. Bring to a simmer, then cover and braise in a preheated oven at 325°F (160°C) for 3-4 hours, or until brisket is fork-tender. 5. Remove brisket and vegetables from pot. Skim excess fat from braising liquid. Thicken sauce with a cornstarch slurry if desired (mix cornstarch with cold water and whisk into sauce, simmer until thickened). Slice brisket against the grain. Serve brisket and vegetables with sauce.

name: Shepherd's Pie (Lamb)
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook potatoes until tender, mash with pareve margarine or olive oil, salt, and pepper. Set aside. 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Brown ground lamb. Drain excess fat. 3. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery, sauté until softened. Add minced garlic and tomato paste, cook for 1 minute. 4. Stir in beef broth, peas, and corn. Season with salt, pepper, and thyme. Simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Transfer meat mixture to a baking dish. Top evenly with mashed potatoes. 6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until potatoes are lightly golden brown. Let cool slightly before serving.

17002.original_quantity: 50g pareve margarine or 2 tbsp olive oil

17016.original_quantity: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

name: Chicken Stir-fry with Vegetables
instructions: 1. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Marinate chicken with soy sauce and cornstarch for 15 minutes. 2. Chop vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas). Mince garlic and ginger. 3. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry chicken until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from wok. 4. Add more oil to the wok. Stir-fry vegetables until tender-crisp. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds. 5. Return chicken to the wok. Add stir-fry sauce (soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch slurry). Stir-fry until sauce thickens and coats everything. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

18001.original_quantity: 500g chicken breasts or thighs, boneless, skinless

name: Beef Empanadas (baked)
instructions: 1. Prepare empanada dough (or use store-bought kosher pareve empanada discs). 2. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Brown ground beef. Drain excess fat. 3. Add chopped onions, bell peppers, and olives, sauté until softened. Add ground cumin, paprika, dried oregano, salt, and pepper, cook for 1 minute. 4. Let filling cool slightly. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). 5. Assemble empanadas: place a spoonful of filling in the center of each dough disc. Fold dough over filling to form a half-moon shape, crimp edges with a fork to seal. 6. Brush empanadas with beaten egg (optional - for golden color, omit for strict pareve/vegan). 7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve warm with chimichurri sauce (optional).

19001.original_quantity: 1 package empanada dough discs (kosher pareve) OR homemade dough from recipe

name: Potato Latkes
instructions: 1. Peel and grate potatoes and onions. Place grated mixture in a clean kitchen towel or cheesecloth and squeeze out as much liquid as possible. 2. Transfer drained potato mixture to a bowl. Add egg, matzah meal or flour, salt, and pepper. Mix well to combine. 3. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drop spoonfuls of potato mixture into hot oil, flatten slightly with a spatula. 4. Fry latkes for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with applesauce or pareve sour cream (optional).

20008.original_quantity: 200g applesauce or pareve sour cream, for serving (optional)

name: Hummus with Pita Bread
instructions: 1. If using dried chickpeas, soak them overnight. Cook chickpeas until very tender. If using canned, drain and rinse. 2. In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and ice water. 3. Process until very smooth and creamy, scraping down sides as needed. Add more ice water if needed to achieve desired consistency. 4. Drizzle hummus with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika (optional). Serve with warm pita bread, vegetables (cucumbers, carrots, bell peppers), and olives.

21001.original_quantity: 250g dried chickpeas OR 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas

21006.original_quantity: 1/4 cup ice water, or more as needed

21009.original_quantity: 1 package pita bread, warmed, for serving

21010.original_quantity: 300g assorted vegetables, for serving (cucumbers, carrots, bell peppers)

name: Falafel
instructions: 1. Soak dried chickpeas overnight. Drain and rinse. 2. In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onions, parsley, cilantro, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper. Process until coarsely ground but not completely smooth. 3. Form mixture into small balls or patties. Let rest for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. 4. Heat vegetable oil for deep frying to 350°F (175°C). Carefully fry falafel in batches for 3-4 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot in pita bread with hummus, tahini sauce, Israeli salad, and pickles.

name: Shakshuka
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onions and bell peppers, sauté until softened. 2. Add minced garlic and paprika, cook for 1 minute. 3. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, cumin, and chili flakes (optional). Simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally. 4. Make wells in the tomato sauce with a spoon. Crack eggs into each well. 5. Cover skillet and cook for 5-10 minutes, or until egg whites are set and yolks are cooked to your liking. Garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro before serving. Serve with crusty bread for dipping.

23011.original_quantity: 1/4 cup fresh parsley or cilantro, chopped, for garnish

name: Matzah Ball Soup (Pareve)
instructions: 1. Prepare matzah balls: In a bowl, combine matzah meal, pareve schmaltz or vegetable oil, eggs, and seltzer or water. Season with salt and pepper. Mix gently and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. 2. Prepare soup broth: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot. Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery, sauté until softened. Add vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. 3. Wet hands with cold water and form matzah ball mixture into balls. Gently drop matzah balls into simmering broth. 4. Cover pot and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until matzah balls are cooked through and fluffy. Garnish with fresh dill before serving.

24002.original_quantity: 1/4 cup pareve schmaltz or vegetable oil

24012.original_quantity: 1/4 cup fresh dill, chopped, for garnish

name: Pareve Cholent (Bean and Barley Stew)
instructions: 1. Soak beans overnight. Drain and rinse. 2. In a large pot or slow cooker, combine soaked beans, barley, potatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, garlic, and vegetable broth. 3. Add paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, and bay leaf. 4. Bring to a boil (if using stovetop pot), then reduce heat to very low, cover, and simmer for at least 3-4 hours, or cook in slow cooker on low for 6-8 hours, or until beans and barley are very tender. 5. Check liquid levels during cooking and add more broth or water if needed. Adjust seasoning to taste before serving.

25007.original_quantity: 2000ml vegetable broth, or more as needed

25011.original_quantity: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

name: Pareve Chocolate Babka
instructions: 1. Prepare dough: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, yeast, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together warm water, oil, and vanilla extract. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and mix until a shaggy dough forms. Knead for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place for 1.5-2 hours, or until doubled in size. 2. Prepare filling: In a bowl, combine melted pareve chocolate, sugar, cocoa powder, and oil. Mix well. 3. Assemble babka: Roll out dough into a large rectangle. Spread chocolate filling evenly over dough, leaving a small border. Roll dough tightly into a log, starting from one long side. Cut log lengthwise in half. Twist two halves together, cut sides facing up, to form babka. Place babka in a greased loaf pan. Cover and let rise for 45-60 minutes. 4. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Bake babka for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

26001.original_quantity: 3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

name: Pareve Apple Crumble
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Prepare apple filling: Peel, core, and slice apples. In a bowl, toss apples with lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Spread apple mixture in a baking dish. 2. Prepare crumble topping: In a separate bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, oats, and salt. Cut in cold pareve margarine or vegetable shortening using a pastry blender or your fingers until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 3. Sprinkle crumble topping evenly over apple filling. 4. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until topping is golden brown and apples are tender. Serve warm, with pareve vanilla ice cream (optional).

27001.original_quantity: 6 apples (Granny Smith or Honeycrisp), peeled, cored, and sliced

27010.original_quantity: 1/2 cup cold pareve margarine or vegetable shortening, cut into cubes

name: Pareve Chocolate Cake
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a cake pan. 2. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. 3. In a separate bowl, whisk together vegetable oil, eggs, buttermilk (pareve or use soy milk with lemon juice), and vanilla extract. 4. Gradually add wet ingredients to dry ingredients, mixing until just combined. Stir in hot coffee or water. Batter will be thin. 5. Pour batter into prepared cake pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely. Frost with pareve chocolate frosting (optional).

28009.original_quantity: 1 cup buttermilk (pareve or soy milk with 1 tbsp lemon juice)

28011.original_quantity: 1 cup hot coffee or hot water

name: Fruit Salad
instructions: 1. Wash and cut fruits into bite-sized pieces. Choose a variety of seasonal fruits like melon, berries, grapes, oranges, apples, pears, etc. 2. Combine all cut fruits in a large bowl. 3. Optional: dress fruit salad with a light dressing of lemon juice and honey or maple syrup. Toss gently. 4. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh mint leaves (optional).

29008.original_quantity: 2 tbsp honey or maple syrup (optional, for dressing)

29009.original_quantity: 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, for garnish (optional)

name: Gazpacho
instructions: 1. Roughly chop tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, and red onion. Mince garlic. 2. In a blender, combine chopped vegetables, garlic, tomato juice, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. 3. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. 4. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving, or preferably overnight, to allow flavors to meld. Serve cold, garnished with diced cucumber, bell pepper, or croutons (optional, pareve).

30003.original_quantity: 2 bell peppers (green or red), roughly chopped

30008.original_quantity: 2 tbsp red wine vinegar or sherry vinegar

30010.original_quantity: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

30011.original_quantity: 100g diced cucumber, bell pepper, or croutons, for garnish (optional)
